journal-title-group.journal-title: Texas Studies in Literature and Language

title-group.article-title: Globalizing Jewish Communities: Mapping a Jewish Geography in Fragment VII of the <italic>Canterbury Tales</italic>

The Latin reads, "miserunt ad omnesfere Angliœ civitates, in quibus Judœi degebant, & convocarunt de unaquaq; civitate aliquos Judxorum, ut in contumeliam & opprobrium Jesu Christi, intéressent sacrifício suo Lincolnia. Habebant enim, ut dicebant, quendam puerum absconditum ad crucifigenum. Et convenerunt multi Lincolnia. Et convenientes, constituerunt unum Juddeum Lincolniensum pro Judice, tanquam pro Pïlato. Cujus judicio & omnium favore, affectus est puer diversis tormentis." The Latin is taken from Matthew Paris, Historia Major (London, 1684), 784-85 at 784;
J. W. R Hill's in Medieval Lincoln (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1948), 224-25 at 224.
